intro: Diplotaxis glabra, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Diplotaxis glabra is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
